intro: Rhipidoglossum tanneri, commonly known as the Tanner's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, fleshy fruits. Rhipidoglossum tanneri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
